laboratory_examinations.findings: 126 mg/dL (7.0 mmol/L) - annual well visit, 112 mg/dL (6.2 mmol/L; reference range, <100 mg/dL) - fasting test, 217 mg/dL (12.0 mmol/L) - random blood glucose with polyuria.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood glucose decreased from 126 mg/dL to 112 mg/dL over one year. Random glucose level was significantly elevated at 217 mg/dL nine years prior, indicating progression.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 5.8% (reference range, 4.3 to 5.6) with normal hemoglobin level; 5.9% one year later; decreased to 5.5% after dietary changes.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial level was 5.8%, increased to 5.9%, then decreased to 5.5% after lifestyle changes over six months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 186 mg/dL (10.3 mmol/L; reference range, <140 mg/dL) at 26 weeks gestation.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No previous results specified for comparison.
Increased from 120 mg/dL at six weeks postpartum to 133 mg/dL six weeks later, indicating rising levels.
Indicates significant hyperglycemia at this time.
Increased from 5.5% to 6.1% indicating worsening glycemic control.
